seo.title: Kling 3 Pro – Multi-shot Text & Image to Video | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate longer, multi-shot Kling 3 Pro videos with scene-level prompts, elements, and optional voice control. 3–15s clips with native audio.

overview: Kling 3 Pro in MaxVideoAI is built for storyboard-style control: multi-shot prompts, reusable Elements, optional end frames, and native audio with voice IDs. Create 3–15s clips from text or image inputs with 1080p output and flexible aspect ratios.
pricingNotes: Pricing is per second: $0.336/s with audio, $0.224/s audio off, $0.392/s with voice control.

hero.title: Kling 3 Pro – Multi-shot cinematic control
hero.intro: Scene-level prompts, Elements, voice IDs, and end-frame control for premium cinematic beats.

items.title: Product hero sequences with clean landings (end frame)

technicalOverview.label: Details
technicalOverview.body: Kling 3 Pro is built for structured generation: multi-shot prompting (multi_prompt), reusable Elements (@Element1...), optional end frame, and native audio with optional voice IDs. Treat it like a storyboard pass: label shots, keep each shot to one clear action, and reuse the same anchors (subject, wardrobe/props, lighting) across shots.

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text → Video; Image → Video (PNG/JPG/WebP), optional end frame

technicalOverview.label: Controls
technicalOverview.body: Multi-prompt scenes, elements, shot type, voice IDs

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Native audio on by default; toggle off or enable voice control

promptStructure.title: Prompting Kling 3 Pro
promptStructure.quote: Scene 1: [shot]. Scene 2: [shot]. Scene 3: [shot]. Add durations for each scene and include audio or dialogue cues.
promptStructure.description: Use multi-prompt to break a clip into scenes and keep continuity with elements and an end frame.
steps: Assign a duration to each scene

promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI — your prompt controls shot timing, camera, lighting, style, and audio cues. Keep one action per shot.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Total duration across scenes must be 3–15s.
Use elements to keep characters and objects consistent.
Voice control is optional and adds a small fee.
Add an end frame for smoother I2V continuity.

prompts.title: Multi-scene city montage
prompts.prompt: Scene 1 (4s): wide skyline at dusk, slow dolly. Scene 2 (5s): close-up neon reflections in rain, shallow depth. Scene 3 (4s): hero walk-through alley, ambient audio.

prompts.title: Product hero sequence
prompts.prompt: Scene 1 (5s): macro watch face, crisp reflections. Scene 2 (4s): rotating hero shot with rim light. Scene 3 (4s): wrist-on model, soft ambience.

faqs.a: It lets you split a clip into multiple scenes with independent prompts and durations.
Yes. Provide voice IDs to enable voice control (adds a small per-second fee).
Yes. Use a start image and optionally an end frame for smoother transitions.

heroHighlights: Multi-shot storyboards in one render||Direct a clip shot-by-shot (up to ~6 shots) instead of cramming everything into one paragraph
Elements for stable characters and props||Define characters/objects once, then reference them as @Element1 / @Element2 across shots to reduce drift
Voice control when audio matters||Optional voice IDs let you keep the same voice across takes; reference them as <<<voice_1>>> / <<<voice_2>>> (max 2)
End frame for cleaner finishes||Use an optional end frame to land transitions, match cuts, and product reveals more predictably
Shot type for faster coverage||Choose shot_type depending on intent: "intelligent" for automatic coverage, "customize" for strict shot control
custom.specTitle: Real Specs – Kling 3 Pro in MaxVideoAI
custom.specNote: Specs reflect the live Fal routing today.

specSections.title: Multi-shot control
specSections.intro: Break a clip into timed shots for storyboard-level direction up to 15s.
items: Use 2–4 shots for the cleanest continuity.
Keep one clear action per shot.
Call out framing + one camera move per shot.

specSections.title: Continuity + audio
specSections.intro: Elements, voice IDs, and end frame help stabilize characters, props, and sound.
items: Optional end frame for clean landings.
Native audio on/off in the same render.

custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Kling 3 Pro Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Kling 3 Pro performs best with shot-based direction: clear framing, one action per shot, explicit camera motion, and (if audio is on) short dialogue plus minimal sound cues.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Think in shots, not clips: one readable action per shot.
Put framing + camera movement before style adjectives.
Anchor subjects early (and reuse the same wording) to reduce drift across shots.
If audio is on: keep dialogue short and add only 1–2 sound cues.
promptingEngineWhy: multi_prompt: use 2–4 shots for best consistency; keep total duration within 15s.
Elements: reference @Element1/@Element2 consistently across shots to stabilize identity/props.
Voice IDs: reference voices as <<<voice_1>>> / <<<voice_2>>> (max 2 voices).
Audio: native audio supports English/Chinese; other languages may be auto-translated to English when audio is enabled.
End frame: avoid introducing new actions in the final second; describe the final pose/composition clearly.
shot_type: "intelligent" helps with automatic coverage; "customize" is better for strict shot control.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.
promptingTabNotes.storyboard: Storyboard = shot timing. Use for multi-shot beats.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
[One subject] [one visible action] in [setting], [framing + one camera move], [lighting/style].
Audio (optional): [ambience + 1 SFX cue OR one short line].
Negative: no text, no logos, no subtitles/overlays.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Scene anchors:
[Subject + wardrobe/props + 2–3 environment anchors.]

Multi-shot plan (3–15s total):
Shot 1 (0–4s): [framing + action + one camera move]
Shot 2 (4–10s): [framing + action + one camera move]
Shot 3 (10–15s): [final action/reveal + settle]

Elements (optional):
@Element1 = [main character/subject]
@Element2 = [prop/product]

Audio (optional):
Dialogue: <<<voice_1>>> “Short line.”
Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues. Keep it minimal.

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No subtitles/overlays.

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "film crew brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific cinematic look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Director brief:
[Goal + vibe + intended audience.]

Continuity (repeat across shots):
- Subject identity + wardrobe/props
- Location + time + 3 visual anchors
- Lighting + palette anchors
- Lens feel + one camera move per shot

Shot type:
[customize | intelligent]

Multi-shot plan (up to 15s total, up to ~6 shots):
Shot 1: [framing + action + camera]
Shot 2: [framing + action + camera]
Shot 3: [framing + action + camera]
(optional) Shot 4–6: [only if needed]

Elements:
@Element1 = [character]
@Element2 = [product/prop]

Audio (if on):
Dialogue: <<<voice_1>>> “One short line.”
Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues + optional music vibe.

End frame (optional):
[Describe the final frame you want to land on.]

Negative:
No text, no logos, no subtitles/overlays, no jump cuts.

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (multi-shot / shot list)
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you want a mini-story in one clip. A storyboard prompt (aka multi-shot / shot list prompt) gives clear timing, camera direction, and continuity. Also called shot-list or sequenced prompts.
promptingTabs.copy:
Duration: [3–15s] • Aspect: [16:9 / 9:16 / 1:1] • Audio: [on/off] • shot_type: [customize | intelligent]

Elements (optional):
@Element1 = [main character/subject]
@Element2 = [prop/product]

Shot 1 (0–3s):
[Framing + action + camera move]

Shot 2 (3–8s):
[Framing + action + camera move]

Shot 3 (8–15s):
[Final action/reveal + camera settle]
End frame (optional): [describe the final frame you want to land on]

Audio (if on):
Dialogue: <<<voice_1>>> “Short line.”
Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues.

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No subtitles/overlays. Keep it to one action per shot.

custom.tipsIntro: Kling 3 Pro is most predictable when you plan it like a storyboard: simple shots, consistent elements, and short dialogue.
strengths: 3–15s clips with 2–4 shots and clear shot labels.
Use Elements for characters/props you want to keep stable.
For audio: one short line + ambience + 1 key SFX (keep it minimal).
Use an end frame when you need a clean landing or match cut.
Pick shot_type intentionally (intelligent for coverage, customize for strict control).
troubleshootingItems: Drift across shots → repeat anchors + use @Element references; simplify each shot to one action.
Camera feels chaotic → one move per shot; avoid "dynamic"; specify "smooth track" or "tripod-stable".
Dialogue/lip sync drifts → shorten lines; reduce fast head turns; keep the shot calmer.
Random text/logos → strengthen negative ("no text, no logos, no UI") and keep signage out of frame.
boundaries: Short-form only (up to 15s); stitch for longer narratives.
Voice IDs are limited (max 2) and audio language behavior depends on routing.
End frame is optional and works best when the final composition is clearly described.
custom.galleryIntro: Recent Kling 3 Pro renders with multi-shot prompts, Elements, and voice control.
